Method Detail

addFederationStateListener

public void addFederationStateListener(ControlFederateListenerRemote federationStateListener)
                                throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Description copied from interface: ControlFederateRemote
Registers a listener with the control federate. The listener receives all state changes and any exceptions that are thrown while the control federate is processing callbacks from the RTI.

Specified by:
addFederationStateListener in interface ControlFederateRemote
Parameters:
federationStateListener - the listener. Must to be exported by RemoteAppModule.export(Remote).
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if a communication error occurs

init

public void init(long timeout,
                 java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
          throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                 FederationException
Causes a transition from the state FederationState.NOT_INITIALIZED to FederationState.INITIALIZED, while during the state transition it the state is set to FederationState.INITIALIZING. Postconditions:
  • ControlFederateRemote.getState() returns FederationState.INITIALIZED
  • The control federate has joined to the CRC
  • The federation execution has been created on the CRC
  • The synchronization point EODISP_INIT has been announced to the federation
  • All federates have registered with the control federate using the interaction 'RegisterFederate(...)'

Specified by:
init in interface ControlFederateRemote
Parameters:
timeout - the maximum time to wait. If this timeout expires before all postconditions met, a FederationException is thrown.
unit - the time unit of the timeout argument.
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted while waiting.
FederationException - If, for any reason, the FederationState.INITIALIZED state could not be reached. This includes the case of timeout expiration. Use Throwable.getCause() to get the actual cause of the exception. Implementation classes should document all exception that can cause this exception to allow a client to react differently to each cause.

pause

public void pause()
It may take up to 30 seconds for this method to return. Causes a transition from the state FederationState.STARTED to FederationState.PAUSED, while during the state transition it the state is set to FederationState.PAUSING. Postconditions:
  • ControlFederateRemote.getState() returns FederationState.PAUSED
  • The synchronization point EODISP_PAUSE has been announced and the federation has synchronized at this point

Specified by:
pause in interface ControlFederateRemote

step

public void step()
It may take up to 30 seconds for this method to return. Causes a transition from the state FederationState.PAUSED to FederationState.PAUSED, while during the state transition it the state is set to FederationState.STEPPING. Postconditions:
  • ControlFederateRemote.getState() returns FederationState.PAUSED
  • The synchronization point EODISP_STEP has been announced and the federation has synchronized at this point

Specified by:
step in interface ControlFederateRemote

resume

public void resume()
It may take up to 30 seconds for this method to return. Causes a transition from the state FederationState.PAUSED to FederationState.STARTED, while during the state transition it the state is set to FederationState.RESUMING. Postconditions:
  • ControlFederateRemote.getState() returns FederationState.STARTED
  • The synchronization point EODISP_RESUME has been announced and the federation has synchronized at this point

Specified by:
resume in interface ControlFederateRemote

start

public void start(long timeout,
                  java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
           throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                  FederationException,
                  java.rmi.RemoteException
Causes a transition from the state FederationState.INITIALIZED to FederationState.STARTED, while during the state transition it the state is set to FederationState.STARTING. Postconditions:
  • ControlFederateRemote.getState() returns FederationState.STARTED
  • The synchronization point EODISP_START has been announced and the federation synchronized at this point.
  • The synchronization point EODISP_STOP has been announced and the federation synchronized at this point.
  • All participating federates have resigned from the federation execution and the federation has been destroyed

The control federate shuts down itself after waiting for 2 seconds after the start call has returned.

Specified by:
start in interface ControlFederateRemote
Parameters:
timeout - the maximum time to wait. If this timeout expires before all postconditions met, a FederationException is thrown.
unit - the time unit of the timeout argument.
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted while waiting.
FederationException - If, for any reason, the FederationState.STARTED state could not be reached. This includes the case of timeout expiration. Use Throwable.getCause() to get the actual cause of the exception. Implementation classes should document all exception that can cause this exception to allow a client to react differently to each cause.
java.rmi.RemoteException - if a communication error occurs

                                    hla.rti1516.TransportationType theTransport)
                             throws hla.rti1516.InteractionClassNotRecognized,
                                    hla.rti1516.InteractionParameterNotRecognized,
                                    hla.rti1516.InteractionClassNotSubscribed,
                                    hla.rti1516.FederateInternalError
Receives a RegisterFederate interaction.

Specified by:
receiveRegisterFederate in interface ControlFederateInteractionListener
Parameters:
federateHandleParam - The federate handle to be registered
userSuppliedTag - a user-supplied tag associated with the interaction
sentOrdering - the type of ordering with which the interaction was sent

hla.rti1516.InteractionClassNotRecognized - if the interaction class was not recognized
hla.rti1516.InteractionParameterNotRecognized - if a parameter of the interaction was not recognized
hla.rti1516.InteractionClassNotSubscribed - if the federate had not subscribed to the interaction class
